comment: Smart Data Models - TransitManagement data Model adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.UrbanMobility/master/TransitManagement/schema.json
description: A public transit system Data Model

contents.name: ac_available
contents.comment: Describes the presence of air conditioning option in the vehicle corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: actual_trip_end_time
contents.comment: This field specifies the time at which service or trip corresponding to this observation is scheduled to end.

contents.name: actual_trip_start_time
contents.comment: This field specifies the time at which service actually began.  This is SameAs: absolute 'time'(StopTimeEvent) in the 'arrival' field of the stop_time_update (StopTimeUpdate) message of the GTFS Realtime message-TripUpdate (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-tripupdate)

contents.name: agency_fare_url
contents.comment: URL of a web page that contains the details of the fares and also could allow to purchase tickets for that agency online. SameAs: 'agency_fare_url' field from GTFS Static Field Definition - agency.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#agencytxt)

contents.name: agency_id
contents.comment: ID that uniquely identifies a transit agency. A transit feed may represent data from more than one agency. The agency_id is dataset unique. This field is optional for transit feeds that only contain data for a single agency. SameAs: 'agency_id' field from GTFS Static Field Definition - agency.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#agencytxt)

contents.name: agency_lang
contents.comment: Contains a two-letter ISO 639-1 code for the primary language used by this transit agency. The language code is case-insensitive (both en and EN are accepted). SameAs: 'agency_lang' field from GTFS Static Field Definition - agency.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#agencytxt)

contents.name: agency_name
contents.comment: The agency_name field contains the full name of the transit agency. SameAs: 'agency_name' field from GTFS Static Field Definition - agency.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#agencytxt)

contents.name: agency_timezone
contents.comment: Timezone field contains the timezone where the transit agency is located. SameAs: 'agency_timezone' field from GTFS Static Field Definition - agency.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#agencytxt)

contents.name: agency_url
contents.comment: The agency_url field contains the URL of the transit agency. SameAs: 'agency_url' field from GTFS Static Field Definition - agency.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#agencytxt)

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: arrival_time
contents.comment: Specifies the arrival time at a specific stop for a specific trip on a route. Times must be eight digits in HH:MM:SS format (HH:MM:SS is also accepted, if the hour begins with 0). Note: Trips that span multiple dates will have stop times greater than 24:00:00. For example, if a trip begins at 10:30:00 p.m. and ends at 2:15:00 a.m. on the following day, the stop times would be 22:30:00 and 26:15:00. Entering those stop times as 22:30:00 and 02:15:00 would not produce the desired results. SameAs: 'arrival_tim

contents.name: bearing
contents.comment: Gives the vehicle GPS angle measured in a clockwise direction from the True North. SameAs 'bearing' field from GTFS Realtime message-Position(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-position)

contents.name: current_status
contents.comment: Describes the status of the vehicle w.r.t the stop corresponding to this observation ENUM: [INCOMING_AT, STOPPED_AT, IN_TRANSIT_TO]. SameAs:'current_status' field from GTFS Realtime message-VehiclePosition(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-vehicleposition)

contents.name: current_stop_sequence
contents.comment: Gives the stop sequence index of the current stop. This is determined by considering current_status, if current_status is missing IN_TRANSIT_TO is assumed. SameAs:'current_stop_sequence' field from GTFS Realtime message-VehiclePosition(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-vehicleposition)

contents.name: dataDescriptor
contents.comment: URI pointing to the data-descriptor entity

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: departure_time
contents.comment:
Specifies the departure time from a specific stop for a specific trip on a route. Times must be eight digits in HH:MM:SS format (HH:MM:SS is also accepted, if the hour begins with 0). 
Note: Trips that span multiple dates will have stop times greater than 24:00:00. For example, if a trip begins at 10:30:00 p.m. and ends at 2:15:00 a.m. on the following day, the stop times would be 22:30:00 and 26:15:00. Entering those stop times as 22:30:00 and 02:15:00 would not produce the desired results. SameAs: 'depart

contents.name: depot_id
contents.comment: Describes the unique id of the bus depot corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: depot_name
contents.comment: Describes the depot name of the bus depot corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: direction_id
contents.comment: Indicates the direction of travel of the vehicle corresponding to this observation, can be referenced from the GTFS static feed trips.txt. SameAs: 'direction_id' field from GTFS Realtime message-TripDescriptor (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-tripdescriptor)

contents.name: entity_id
contents.comment: Feed unique ID for the entity corressponding to this observation.SameAs:'entity_id' field from GTFS Realtime message-FeedEntity(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-feedentity)

contents.name: last_stop_arrival_time
contents.comment:
Specifies the arrival time at the previous stop for a specific trip on a route. Times must be eight digits in HH:MM:SS format (H:MM:SS is also accepted, if the hour begins with 0). 
Note: Trips that span multiple dates will have stop times greater than 24:00:00. For example, if a trip begins at 10:30:00 p.m. and ends at 2:15:00 a.m. on the following day, the stop times would be 22:30:00 and 26:15:00. Entering those stop times as 22:30:00 and 02:15:00 would not produce the desired results. This is SameAs: ab

contents.name: last_stop_id
contents.comment: Stop ID/Stop name of the previous bus stop corresponding to the bus in this observation. SameAs: 'stop_id' field from GTFS Realtime message-VehiclePosition (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-vehicleposition)

contents.name: last_tracked_time
contents.comment: Gives the time at which the vehicle was last tracked.

contents.name: license_plate
contents.comment: Gives the License Plate number of the vehicle. SameAs: 'license_plate' field from GTFS Realtime message-VehicleDescriptor (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-vehicledescriptor)

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: observationDateTime
contents.comment: Last reported time of observation.

contents.name: route_color
contents.comment: If assigned, this field defines a color that corresponds to a route. The color must be provided as a six-character hexadecimal number, for example, 00FFFF. If no color is specified, the default route color is white (FFFFFF). SameAs: 'route_color' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-routes.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#routestxt)

contents.name: route_desc
contents.comment: Description of the route. This can include the entire route details including to and from destination and timing information in a text description form. SameAs: 'route_desc' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-routes.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#routestxt)

contents.name: route_id
contents.comment: Route ID assigned to the route on which the bus/vehicle corresponding to the bus in this observation is currently plying on. SameAs: 'route_id' field from GTFS Realtime message-TripDescriptor (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-tripdescriptor)

contents.name: route_long_name
contents.comment: Full name of a route. This name is more descriptive than the routeShortName and often includes the route's destination or stop. This mostly includes the to and from destination names of the route. SameAs: 'route_long_name' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-routes.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#routestxt)

contents.name: route_short_name
contents.comment: Short name of a route. This will often be the transit vehicle's board name like '402D',  or 'Green' that riders use to identify a route. SameAs: 'route_short_name' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-routes.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#routestxt)

contents.name: route_text_color
contents.comment: This field can be used to specify a legible color to use for text drawn against a background of route_color. The color must be provided as a six-character hexadecimal number, for example, FFD700. If no color is specified, the default text color is black (000000). SameAs: 'route_text_color' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-routes.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#routestxt)

contents.name: route_type
contents.comment: Number indicating the type of transport-1 - Subway, Metro. Any underground rail system within a metropolitan area.2 - Rail. Used for intercity or long-distance travel.3 - Bus. Used for short- and long-distance bus routes. SameAs: 'route_type' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-routes.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#routestxt)

contents.name: route_url
contents.comment: Contains the URL of a web page about that particular route and is different from the agency_url. SameAs: 'route_url' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-routes.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#routestxt)

contents.name: schedule_relationship
contents.comment: Describes if the Route/Trip has been scheduled. SameAs: 'schedule_relationship' field from enumScheduleRelationship (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#enum-schedulerelationship-2)

contents.name: seating_capacity
contents.comment: Describes the passenger seating capacity of the vehicle corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: speed
contents.comment: Gives the Speed  of the vehicle. SameAs 'speed' field from GTFS Realtime message-Position(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-position)

contents.name: standing_capacity
contents.comment: Describes the passenger standing capacity of the vehicle corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: start_date
contents.comment: Describes the initial scheduled date of the trip corresponding to the vehicle this observation. An example format for this field - YYYYMMDD. SameAs: 'start_date' field from GTFS Realtime message-TripDescriptor (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-tripdescriptor)

contents.name: start_time
contents.comment: Describes the initial scheduled start time of the trip corresponding to the vehicle this observation. An example format for this field - 11:15:35 or 25:15:35. SameAs: 'start_time' field from GTFS Realtime message-TripDescriptor (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-tripdescriptor)

contents.name: stop_code
contents.comment: This field contains short text or a number that uniquely identifies the stop for passengers. Can be same as stop_id if it is for public. SameAs: 'stop_code' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-stops.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#stopstxt)

contents.name: stop_desc
contents.comment: This field contains a description of a stop. SameAs: 'stop_desc' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-stops.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#stopstxt)

contents.name: stop_headsign
contents.comment: This field contains the text that appears on a sign that identifies the trip’s destination to passengers. SameAs: 'stop_headsign' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-stop_times.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#stop_timestxt)

contents.name: stop_id
contents.comment: Stop ID/Stop name of the bus stops corresponding to the bus in this observation. SameAs: 'stop_id' field from GTFS Realtime message-Vehicleposition (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-vehicleposition)

contents.name: stop_name
contents.comment: Describes the name of the Bus Stop. SameAs: 'stop_name' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-stops.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#stopstxt)

contents.name: stop_sequence
contents.comment: Indicates the stop sequence of the vehicle corresponding to this observation, can be referenced from the GTFS static feed stop_times.txt. SameAs: 'stop_sequence' field from GTFS Realtime message-StopTimeUpdate (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-stoptimeupdate)

contents.name: stop_url
contents.comment: This field contains the URL of a web page about a particular stop and is different from the agency_url and the route_url fields. SameAs: 'stop_url' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-stops.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#stopstxt)

contents.name: timestamp
contents.comment: Last reported time of observation from the vehicle. SameAs: 'timestamp' field from GTFS Realtime message-Vehicleposition (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-vehicleposition)

contents.name: travelDistance
contents.comment: The distance between the origin bus stop and the destination bus stop or the total distance travelled corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: travelTime
contents.comment: The time taken to travel between the origin bus stop and the destination bus stop corresponding to this observation in HH:MM:SS format(HH:MM:SS is also accepted, if the hour begins with 0).

contents.name: tripDirection
contents.comment: Gives the direction in which the vehicle is travelling in ENUM[UP,DN]

contents.name: trip_delay
contents.comment: This can be positive and negative in seconds and shows how much the vehicle deviates from the planned one. SameAs: 'delay' field from GTFS Realtime message-StopTimeEvent (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-stoptimeevent)

contents.name: trip_direction
contents.comment: Gives the direction in which the vehicle is travelling. SameAs: 'direction_id' field from GTFS Realtime message-TripDescriptor but is represented in the form of an ENUM[UP,DN] in place of [0,1] as seen in 'direction_id' (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-tripdescriptor).

contents.name: trip_id
contents.comment: Trip ID/Trip name allotted to the bus corresponding to this observation, in consideration to the time of the day and the direction of the trip on the given routeId. SameAs: 'trip_id' field from GTFS Realtime message-TripDescriptor (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-tripdescriptor)

contents.name: uncertainty
contents.comment: If uncertainty is omitted, it is interpreted as unknown. To specify a completely certain prediction, set its uncertainty to 0.SameAs: 'uncertainty' field from GTFS Realtime message-StopTimeEvent (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-stoptimeevent)

contents.name: vehicle_id
contents.comment: Unique ID assigned to the vehicle corresponding to this observation, used in internal system identification. SameAs: 'id' field from GTFS Realtime message-VehicleDescriptor (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-vehicledescriptor)

contents.name: vehicle_label
contents.comment: User visible label, i.e., something that must be shown to the passenger to help identify the correct vehicle. SameAs: 'label' field from GTFS Realtime message-VehicleDescriptor (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-vehicledescriptor)

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: routeStopSequence
contents.comment: Gives the stop IDs/stop codes or station IDs/station codes in the right sequence for the route or line corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address

contents.name: arrival
contents.comment: If schedule_relationship is empty or SCHEDULED, either arrival or departure must be provided within a StopTimeUpdate. SameAs: 'arrival' field from GTFS Realtime message-StopTimeUpdate (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-stoptimeupdate)

contents.name: departure
contents.comment: If schedule_relationship is empty or SCHEDULED, either arrival or departure must be provided within a StopTimeUpdate. SameAs: 'departure' field from GTFS Realtime message-StopTimeUpdate (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-stoptimeupdate)

contents.name: deviceInfo
contents.comment: Information about the device associated with the observations.

contents.name: position
contents.comment: Describes the current position of the vehicle corresponding to this observation. SameAs:'position' field from GTFS Realtime message-VehiclePosition(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-vehicleposition)

contents.name: stop_sequence_detail
contents.comment: Describes the stop sequence for a trip in the designated route made by the public transit vehicle.SameAs: 'stop_sequence' field from GTFS Static Field definitions-stop_times.txt (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#stop_timestxt)

contents.name: stop_time_update
contents.comment: Additional information on the vehicle that is serving this trip.

contents.name: trip
contents.comment: Describes the trip the vehicle corresponding to this observation is making. SameAs:'trip' field from GTFS Realtime message-VehiclePosition(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-vehicleposition)(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-tripupdate)

contents.name: tripDetails
contents.comment: A descriptor of realtime update on the schedule of a vehicle along a trip.

contents.name: trip_details
contents.comment: A descriptor of realtime update on the schedule of a vehicle along a trip.

contents.name: trip_update
contents.comment: Describes the trip information like delay, departures, etc., for a trip made by the vehicle corresponding to this observation.SameAs:'trip_update' field from GTFS Realtime message-FeedEntity(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-feedentity).

contents.name: vehicleDesc
contents.comment: Describes the additional information of the vehicle corresponding to this observation. SameAs:'vehicle' field from GTFS Realtime message-VehiclePosition(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-vehicleposition)/(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-tripupdate)

contents.name: vehicle_position
contents.comment: Describes the realtime position of the vehicle corresponding to this observation. SameAs:'vehicle' field from GTFS Realtime message-FeedEntity(https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs-realtime/reference#message-feedentity)
